name: WASH Shell
description: WASH is a custom Unix-like command-line shell that interprets and executes user input in a Linux environment. It supports built-in commands such as directory navigation and help, executes external programs, and includes basic utilities for command output handling. The project was designed to replicate core shell behavior while emphasizing correctness, usability, and modular structure.

name: Portfolio
description: This website, my personal portfolio. This site is built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to showcase my projects, skills, and experience in a clean and responsive design.

name: Hanafuda Rust Game
description: This project is the terminal-based implementation of Hawaiian-style Hanafuda, a  variation of the traditional japanese card game, Hanafuda. Built in Rust, the project recreates the full card-play experience with shuffled dealing, player and CPU turns, card matching, and scoring, all presented through a text interface. It faithfully models game rules and card mechanics, offering a playable version of this classic card game in a console environment. This is the public release of the project done as a term project.

name: GO parser
description: A parser that takes a program written in a custom 4point language and outlets it to scheme or prolog. This consists of a lexer, parser, and code generator with support for error checking and hanging. This was made as a term project for a concepts in programming class. (private until readme is redone)

name: T.A.P Roblox plugin
description: T.A.P. (Terrain Angle Painter) is a Roblox Studio plugin that automatically adjusts terrain materials based on surface angle, making it easy to detail and refine large landscapes without manual painting. Designed to speed up terrain workflows, the tool lets creators define custom settings and quickly apply material changes across complex terrain surfaces, improving efficiency and visual consistency in world building.  Additionally, it uses procedural generation techniques such as perlin noise to generate terrain variations.

name: proximity prompt v2
description: Custom Proximity Prompt V2 is an enhanced community resource for Roblox developers that replaces the default proximity interaction UI with a fully customizable prompt system that is easily modifiable graphically. It uses Roblox Studio's UI tools to let creators tailor how interaction prompts look and behave—including new press and hold animations, dynamic input icons based on device type, and optional audio effects—making in-game interactions more polished and personalized.

name: Minecraft shop script generator
description: Minecraft Shop Script Generator is a command-line tool that automatically creates NPC shop scripts for Minecraft servers based on CSV input. Inspired by tutorial systems for scoreboard-based shops and NPC interactions, the program reads item data and pricing information to generate ready-to-use script files, simplifying the otherwise repetitive task of writing shop logic by hand.

name: FRC 2020 Team 4270
description: This is the source code repository for Team 4270's 2020 FIRST Robotics Competition season (“Infinite Recharge”). It includes robot control software used at the Canada Pacific and Hawaii regional events, featuring autonomous targeting with Limelight vision tracking and configurable control mappings. The repo captures iterative development and competition-ready code for a real-world robotics platform. Additionally, this code won the innovation in control award at the Canada-Pacific regional. This seasons code was written by me as the lead programmer for the team.
